1.text: Better is the poor walking in his integrity, Than the perverse in his lips, who is a fool.

2.text: Also, without knowledge the soul is not good, And the hasty in feet is sinning.

3.text: The folly of man perverteth his way, And against Jehovah is his heart wroth.

4.text: Wealth addeth many friends, And the poor from his neighbour is separated.

5.text: A false witness is not acquitted, Whoso breatheth out lies is not delivered.

6.text: Many entreat the face of the noble, And all have made friendship to a man of gifts.

7.text: All the brethren of the poor have hated him, Surely also his friends have been far from him, He is pursuing words—they are not!

8.text: Whoso is getting heart is loving his soul, He is keeping understanding to find good.

9.text: A false witness is not acquitted, And whoso breatheth out lies perisheth.

10.text: Luxury is not comely for a fool, Much less for a servant to rule among princes.

11.text: The wisdom of a man hath deferred his anger, And his glory is to pass over transgression.

12.text: The wrath of a king is a growl as of a young lion, And as dew on the herb his good-will.

13.text: A calamity to his father is a foolish son, And the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

14.text: House and wealth are the inheritance of fathers, And from Jehovah is an understanding wife.

15.text: Sloth causeth deep sleep to fall, And an indolent soul doth hunger.

16.text: Whoso is keeping the command is keeping his soul, Whoso is despising His ways dieth.

17.text: Whoso is lending to Jehovah is favouring the poor, And his deed He repayeth to him.

18.text: Chastise thy son, for there is hope, And to put him to death lift not up thy soul.

19.text: A man of great wrath is bearing punishment, For, if thou dost deliver, yet again thou dost add.

20.text: Hear counsel and receive instruction, So that thou art wise in thy latter end.

21.text: Many are the purposes in a man’s heart, And the counsel of Jehovah it standeth.

22.text: The desirableness of a man is his kindness, And better is the poor than a liar.

23.text: The fear of Jehovah is to life, And satisfied he remaineth—he is not charged with evil.

24.text: The slothful hath hidden his hand in a dish, Even unto his mouth he bringeth it not back.

25.text: A scorner smite, and the simple acts prudently, And give reproof to the intelligent, He understandeth knowledge.

26.text: Whoso is spoiling a father causeth a mother to flee, A son causing shame, and bringing confusion.

27.text: Cease, my son, to hear instruction—To err from sayings of knowledge.

28.text: A worthless witness scorneth judgment, And the mouth of the wicked swalloweth iniquity.

29.text: Judgments have been prepared for scorners, And stripes for the back of fools!
